review_blob: This is a delicious beer. 750ml. Huge white head with good retention. Dark orange, hazy with very little transparency. Smells of fruit, alcohol and yeast. Taste... less sweet than I expected from the aroma. Bitter with alcohol, cheese, and mild fruit flavors being most dominant.

750ml. The head maintained for at least 5 minutes. Smell was sweet and yeasty with... apples and maybe raisins. Pretty carbonated. Tastes of... fruit, sugar, alcohol and spice. Im looking forward to the next one.
beer_name: De Proefbrouwerij / Allagash Les Deux Brasseurs

review_blob: Clear red-amber with a white head, not much retention. Smells of vinegar and cherries. Tastes of vinegar and cherries. I saw some vinegar and cherries behind the bar. Light palate. Good. Maybe a bit overpriced.

Dark brown pour with some head and pretty flat. Strong aroma of malt, sugar, hops, and oats. Couldnt get too much woody aroma or flavor out of this one, but have had other bottles that do. Flavors are similar to aroma with sweet, hops and bitter providing the biggest contributions.

Finally, a decent beer from New Belgium. Bottle Ive had for a couple months, let warm for about 10-15 minutes. Sour/vinegar aroma overpowers the fruit/sweet quite a bit. Little head with rich brown color and some sediment, not much. Immediate sour with cherries and a kind of smoky wood flavor.

Big and full and... did I say big yet? The name is pretty accurate. Really sweet, with a bit more hops than I was expecting, but then again.... the brewers abundant use of hops should be expected by everyone by now. This was a good beer.

For the cost of this beer it was tremendously disappointing. Not to say the price tag should reflect quality (although there is a pretty direct relationship between the two most of the time), but it certainly does amplify how much of a waste it was to buy. Other than the strong armed presence of raspberries and alcohol, this beer doesnt have much else going on.

a moderately good stout, more carbonated than i prefer (is that common with cooper brews?). i was told while drinking this that it is a bit darker and more full bodied than guinness. i dont necessarily agree with that.
light on flavor and high on carbonation, the photo makes it look a lot darker than it is. this beer is light, no question, but if youre into that sort of thing, this one is decent.

I had high hopes for this brew, considering most of the ratings, and was expecting at least a score of 4. The smell was pleasant and appearance highly drinkable, but as arayaga2 mentions, this beer lacks complexity. The finish is unimpressive and surprisingly light. Maybe it was just the bottle I purchased, but I doubt it.

Grand white head with good retention. Yeast and citrus dominate the aroma. Pale yellow in color with a slight haze when held to light. Taste doesnt differ from the aroma but does have a bit of a tartness near the end. Dry, very dry. A bit uninspired, which is the trend Ive found with saisons in general.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2006
Good, but I prefer the 90 minute. Citrus hops, smelled pretty fresh. Not very complex. Sweet flavor with a large emphasis on hops.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2006
Dark with aromas of sugar and fruit. Palate is smoother and lighter than I was expecting. Flavor dissipates slowly. Nice. I let this one warm up to just below room temp.
Not too shabby. Good head retention and strong flavors of alcohol and overwhelming hops. I know there are better out there but this one is drinkable.

i heard once from an older gentleman that high life was considered a good beer when he was younger. i didnt find it to be quite that, the champaign of beers. and what do macros mean by "smooth"? you hear it everywhere in their marketing campaigns, and yet the only thing that punctuates my high life experience is the twist off cap, a true novelty and sign of quality. miller i salute you.

yep, another hopped up beer. american brewers are all about it. at beer bars, such as the one where i drank this, i feel saturated with the selection of super hopped up beers. granted this one wasnt as hoppy as many an IPA, i still bought a pint because i hadnt had one in a while and the tap selection was limited to macro or hops.

Liquid pumpkin pie, anyone? The overwhelming pumpkin and cinnamon flavor and aroma were quite good. Not well balanced though, the flavors makes a quick exit in exchange for a rich sugar sweetness. Good autumnal refresher.
A light hefeweizen. Similar in flavor but lighter with a watery texture. Nothing spectacular.
Citrus hops, wheat. Yeah, its drinkable. I liked this one, but it didnt merit a 4.

For a belgian strong, this was definitely a bit on the weak side. Lighter in color More like a belgian white but more alcoholic. I was expecting a belgian strong, and thats not exactly what I found. For that reason, I was a bit disappointed. That being said, this was an acceptable beer. Hazy-light yellow in color, it poured thick with an unrelenting head. Fruit flavors have a strong presence throughout with increasing intensity near the end.
Kick start at the front end with a more gentle finish. I like it. Smells of yeast and citrus. This is a little bit more bashful a triple than Im used to.

If FFF were a band, they would play exclusively theatrical power ballads. This beer is no exception to the traditionally aggressive brewing FFF employs, and is a fine example of their craft wIth its loads of well proportioned hoppy-maltiness.

Red-brown color with minimal head in the pour and sweet autumn aromas. Someone definitely put a lot of consideration into making this brew. The flavor has good yeast and malt flavors that mellow out into a pleasant finish. Well rounded. I thoroughly enjoyed drinking this beer.

I was astonished at how little head was in the pour. The aroma was subtle but sweet and the first sip had... cloves. A pretty mild flavor accompanied the rich brown color. Decent malt flavor and balance.

As blonds go, this one is fairly tasty with a good balance. There is a slight bitterness near the end, but it is not enough to take away from the overall drinking experience that is Affligem Blonde. Although good, I wouldnt consider this above and beyond what most belgian whites offer.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2006

Upon first inspection, this beer looks delicious. Excellent pour with a slightly mirky yellow color. Complete with a wheat aroma and a strong apple overtone, this beer has great potential. The taste didnt match up to the beers exterior qualities, which I found a little disappointing. A lighter palate and the fruit flavor/aroma make this an excellent summer refresher, but thats about it.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: UPDATED: SEP 17, 2006
